page.title: 08HEALTH CENTRE FIRE
page.content:
During the early hours of Monday 12th January 1981,{Blantyre Health Centre burned down to the ground. The fire was reported between 3 or 4am. Fire engines rushed to the scene and had put it out before 5.30am. The fire was so intense, the firemen were forced to wear protective clothing and use breathing apparatus.
The damage was very bad. Everything was completely destroyed except the safe. This caused lots of problems for staff and patients. By 10 o'clock, the doctors had started consulting in the old clinic. Due to loss of records it was difficult to prescribe medicine. The porta-cabins were very unhygenic, overcrowded and very inconvenient. It took a long time to replace records
